contextId.information: This can be translated with an active verb.  This is a command. By commanding that the waters gather together, God made them gather together. AT: "Let the waters ... gather" or "Let the waters ... come together" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_imperative]])
contextId.quote: Let the waters ... be gathered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God had finished creating them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were finished

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "there was no companion that was right for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there was found no helper suitable for him

contextId.information: The word "curse" comes first in the sentence to emphasize that the ground, which had been "good" ([[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:09|1:10]]), was now under God's curse. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I am cursing the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: cursed is the ground

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will take vengeance on him seven times" or "I will punish that person seven times as severely as I am punishing you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold

contextId.information: Lamech knows that God will avenge Cain seven times. AT: "Since God will punish anyone who kills Cain seven times, Lamech" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If Cain is avenged seven times, then Lamech

contextId.information: This can be active. AT: "the women bore daughters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: daughters were born to them

contextId.information: If necessary, this can be stated in active form. AT: "So every living thing ... perished" or "So the flood completely destroyed every living thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So every living thing ... was wiped out

contextId.information: "The water stopped coming out of the ground and the rain stopped falling." This can be stated in active form. AT: "God closed the fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven were closed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until the wind dried up the waters" or "until the waters dried up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until the waters were dried up

contextId.information: It is not clear who will see the rainbow, but because the covenant is between Yahweh and people, if you need to say who it is who will see the rainbow, it would be best to name both Yahweh and people. This can be translated in active form. AT: "people and I see the rainbow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the rainbow is seen

contextId.information: This can be made active. AT: "the people of the earth divided themselves" or "the people of the earth separated from one another" or "God divided the people of the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the earth was divided

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we will separate from each other and live in different places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we will be scattered

contextId.information: This can be made active. AT: "I will bless all the families of the earth through you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Through you will all the families of the earth be blessed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Pharaoh took her into his household" or "Pharaoh had his soldiers take her into his household" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the woman was taken into Pharaoh's household

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and the owners of that land will enslave your descendants and oppress them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and will be enslaved and oppressed

contextId.information: This can be stated in an active form. AT: "You must circumcise every male among you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Every male among you must be circumcised

contextId.information: This refers to slaves. This can be stated in active form. AT: "any male that you buy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: him who is bought with money

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form, and you may leave out words that will give wrong meaning in your language. AT: "male whom you have not circumcised" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: uncircumcised male who is not circumcised

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those whom he had bought" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those bought

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let me bring you some water" or "My servant will bring you some water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let a little water be brought

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will bless all the nations of the earth through Abraham" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all the nations of the earth will be blessed in him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active from. AT: "you should treat the righteous the same way you treat the wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the righteous should be treated the same as the wicked

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so Yahweh does not also destroy you when he punishes the people of this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you are not swept away in the punishment of the city

contextId.information: The passive phrase "made right" can be stated in active form. AT: "everyone will know that you are innocent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: before everyone, you are completely made right

contextId.information: The phrase "will be named" means those born through Isaac are the ones God considers to be the descendants that he promised Abraham. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Isaac is the one who will be the forefather of the descendants I promised to give you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is through Isaac that your descendants will be named

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "was a ram whose horns were stuck in the bushes" or "was a ram stuck in the bushes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was a ram caught in the bushes by his horns

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he will provide" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be provided

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I, the Lord, will bless all the people living everywhere" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all the nations of the earth will be blessed

contextId.information: It is not clear who did this work. This may be stated in active form. AT: "Laban's servants unloaded the camels" (UDB) or "the camels were unloaded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he unloaded the camels

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They buried Abraham" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Abraham was buried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will bless all the nations of the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all the nations of the earth will be blessed

contextId.information: Abimelech may have intended to tell someone to kill anyone who might harm Isaac or Rebekah. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will put him to death" or "I will order my men to kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will surely be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has blessed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you are blessed by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May God curse everyone who curses you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May every one who curses you be cursed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for you to gather the flocks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for the flocks to be gathered together

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until the other shepherds gather their flocks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until all the flocks are gathered together

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jacob did not love Leah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Leah was not loved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has heard that my husband does not love me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh has heard that I am unloved

contextId.information: They use a question to show their anger about how their father treats them. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Our father treats us like a foreign women instead of daughters!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Are we not treated by him as foreigners?

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone told Laban" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Laban was told

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When a wild animal killed one of your animals I did not bring it to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: What was torn by beasts I did not bring to you

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "faithfulness" and "trustworthiness" can be stated as "faithful" and "loyal." AT: "I do not deserve for you to remain faithful to your covenant or for you to be loyal to me, your servant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am not worthy of all your acts of covenant faithfulness and of all the trustworthiness that you have done for your servant

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The man injured Jacob's hip as he wrestled with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jacob's hip was dislocated as he wrestled with him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "yet he spared my life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and my life is delivered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that my servants brought to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was brought to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If we force them to go too fast even for one day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If they are driven hard even one day

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for he should not have done such a terrible thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for such a thing should not have been done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "So Hamor and Shechem had someone circumcise all the men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Every male was circumcised

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They buried her down from Bethel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: She was buried down from Bethel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but your name will no longer be Jacob" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but your name will no longer be called Jacob

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and they buried her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and was buried

contextId.information: Jacob thinks that a wild animal has torn Joseph's body apart. AT: "It has certainly torn Joseph to pieces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Joseph has certainly been torn to pieces

contextId.information: This can be written in active form. AT: "His father named him Er" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was named Er

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Judah had not given her to Shelah as a wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she had not been given to him as a wife

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he caused her to become pregnant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she became pregnant by him

contextId.information: Here the word "it" refers to the "prostitution" that she committed. This can be stated in active form. AT: "it has made her pregnant" or "she is pregnant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she is pregnant by it

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we will burn her to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let her be burned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the place where the king put his prisoners" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the place where the king's prisoners were confined

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that were thin and burned because of the hot wind from the east" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: thin and scorched by the east wind

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one would have been able to tell that the thin cows had eaten the fat cows" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it could not be known that they had eaten them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that were withered, thin, and scorched because of the hot wind from the east" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: withered, thin and scorched by the east wind

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "seven thin heads of grain scorched because of the hot wind from the east" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: seven thin heads scorched by the east wind

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "This is how I will test you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: By this you will be tested

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "leave one of your brothers here in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let one of your brothers be confined in this prison

contextId.information: Here "words" stands for what was said. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so I may know what you say is true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so your words will be verified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The servants did for them everything that Joseph commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was done for them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone has put my money back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: My money has been put back

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they were going into Joseph's house" or "the steward was taking them into Joseph's house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were brought to Joseph's house

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they sent the men away, along with their donkeys" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the men were sent away, they and their donkeys

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When someone told Jacob" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When Jacob was told

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they placed him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was placed
